text: Student:  48710202 (S N Green)  Module:  INF3707  Assignment:  2 (728908)    _______________________________________________________________________________________  Page 1 of 2      Question 1    1.1. CREATE SEQUENCE MY_FIRST_SEQ  INCREMENT BY -3 START WITH 5 MAXVALUE 5 MINVALUE 0 NOCYCLE;    1.2. SELECT MY_FIRST_SEQ.NEXTVAL FROM DUAL;    The following error occurs on the third SELECT:  ORA‐08004: sequence MY_FIRST_SEQ.NEXTVAL goes below MINVALUE and cannot be instantiated    The reason is that the next value in the sequence would be ‐1, and that value is not allowed since the  MINVALUE has been set as 0.      Question 2    2.1. CREATE USER sgreen IDENTIFIED BY mypassword;    2.2. CONNECT sgreen/mypassword;    The following error occurs when trying to connect:  ORA‐01045: user SGREEN lacks CREATE SESSION privilege; logon denied    What happened? The account has not yet been given sufficient privileges to connect to the database.    2.3. GRANT CREATE SESSION, CREATE TABLE, ALTER ANY TABLE TO sgreen;    2.4. CREATE ROLE customerrep;  GRANT INSERT, DELETE ON orders TO customerrep; GRANT INSERT, DELETE ON orderitems TO customerrep;                        Student:  48710202 (S N Green)  Module:  INF3707  Assignment:  2 (728908)    _______________________________________________________________________________________  Page 2 of 2      Question 3    3.1. SELECT DISTINCT books.title FROM customers c  JOIN orders USING(customer#) JOIN orderitems USING(order#) JOIN books USING(isbn)  WHERE c.firstname='JAKE' AND c.lastname = 'LUCAS';     3.2. SELECT b.title FROM books b  JOIN bookauthor USING(isbn) JOIN author a USING(authorid) WHERE a.lname='ADAMS';      Question 4    SELECT title AS "Title", category AS "Category", retail AS "Current Price", ROUND(retail * CASE category WHEN 'COMPUTER' THEN 1.1 WHEN 'FITNESS' THEN 1.15 WHEN 'SELF HELP' THEN 1.25 ELSE 1.03 END, 2) AS "Revised Price" FROM books ORDER BY category, title;      Question 5    SELECT order# AS "Order #", SUM(quantity * paideach) AS "Order Value" FROM orderitems HAVING SUM(quantity * paideach) > ( SELECT SUM(quantity * paideach) FROM orderitems WHERE order# = 1008 ) GROUP BY order#;
